arena

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • arena.Direction

  • public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class consisting of helper methods which competitors may use to help them design their Brains.

    • Method Detail

      • roundTo8

        public static int roundTo8(int dir)
        Rounds any angle off to the nearest multiple of 45 degrees, thus pointing it in one of the 8 cardinal directions.

        For example, a call to Direction.roundTo8(142) would return 135, while a call to Direction.roundTo8(400) would return 45.

        Parameters:
        dir - the angle to be rounded
        Returns:
        the nearest of the 8 cardinal directions.

      • roundTo4

        public static int roundTo4(int dir)
        Rounds any angle off to the nearest multiple of 90 degrees, thus pointing it in one of the 4 cardinal directions.
        Parameters:
        dir - the angle to be rounded
        Returns:
        the nearest of the 4 cardinal directions.

      • getLocInDirection

        public static int[] getLocInDirection(int row,
                                      int col,
                                      int dir)
        Returns the nearest adjacent space, relative to a given location, in a given direction. Directions will be rounded off to the nearest of 8 cardinal directions.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the original space
        col - The column of the original space
        dir - The direction from the original space to the final space
        Returns:
        a 2-element array {row, col} containing the coordinates of the nearest adjacent space in the given direction

      • getDirectionTowards

        public static int getDirectionTowards(int row1,
                                      int col1,
                                      int row2,
                                      int col2)
        Calculates the direction from one space to another. The code basically draws a straight line from the origin space to the destination space and computes the closest of the 8 cardinal directions to that line.
        Parameters:
        row1 - The row of the origin space
        col1 - The column of the origin space
        row2 - The row of the destination space
        col2 - The column of the destination space
        Returns:
        the closest direction from (row1, col1) to (row2, col2).

      • moveDistance

        public static int moveDistance(int row1,
                               int col1,
                               int row2,
                               int col2)
        Computes the minimum number of moves required to get from location (row1, col1) to location (row2, col2). Diagonal moves are permitted. Note that blockers and other obstacles are disregarded.
        Parameters:
        row1 - The row of the origin space
        col1 - The column of the origin space
        row2 - The row of the destination space
        col2 - The column of the destination space
        Returns:
        the minimum number of (8-direction) moves required to get from the origin space to the destination space.
